title: Foundational Course in Islamic Religious Education: Project-Based Learning Through Traditional Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Blended educational environment combining traditional teaching methods with PBL using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental Islamic doctrines (Six Articles of Faith and Five Pillars) using a scientific approach.
Learners can develop three or more PBL project topics within a lesson design that applies traditional instructional methods.

Using digital tools (Canva, Adobe Spark, Google Sites), learners produce a 5-page A4 report or 3–5-minute video on Islamic cultural research (e.g., mosque architecture, traditional art, scientific heritage) and achieve ≥80 points on the evaluation rubric (30% content accuracy, 25% creativity, 25% technical completion, 20% visual effects)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
